artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Tsunajima Kamekichi; Carver: Wada Yūjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 503.31; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 280, p. 276.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: woman leaning toward PL, with her head tilted slightly down, holding up her PR hand; woman wears light blue kimono with busy pattern of pink and white blossoms and scalloped cartouches with multicolored geometric patterns and red undergarment with purple collar with blue, green and tan leaves; green and tan obi
markings: Artist’s seal: たいそ {Taiso} | Carver’s seal: 和田彫勇 {Wada hori Yū}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Thirty-two Aspects of Behaviors (Fūzoku sanjūnisō 風俗三十二相)
text: No. 23 on the table of contents
title: Appearing Appalled, Behavior of an Unmarried Woman from Nagoya of the Ansei Era
